question:
Consider the following statements about the National Initiative for Developing and Harnessing Innovations (NIDHI):
  1. It aims to encourage entrepreneurial activity in rural communities
  2. The beneficiaries of the initiative are selected based on their traditional skills, arts and crafts
  3. The scheme is being implemented by the National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC)
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is incorrect</u> because the National Initiative for Developing and Harnessing Innovation (NIDHI) aims to support only students’ startups. A maximum of 20 students’ startups can be supported under the programme. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u> because the students to be benefitted from the programme are being selected through a national level competition. No student can be part of more than one team. <u>Third statement is incorrect</u> because the Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India (EDII), an autonomous body and not-for-profit institution, set up in 1983, is implementing the programme. The institute is sponsored by apex financial institutions, namely the Industrial Development Bank of India (IDBI), IFCI Ltd. ICICI Ltd and State Bank of India (SBI).
